comments.body: In the new Minecraft Bedrock beta there is a mountain cave, but it is a world generation glitch. It should be integrated as biome.
Kinda op, I would make it 1.5x or maybe even less. Other than that, bows have needed tiers outside of enchanting for too long now. This would be a wonderful addition to the game.
Titanium does not exist in nature in its pure form. To obtain it, chemical reactions are used.
Titanium does not have the required elasticity. It is highly likely that a titanium bow will be much worse than a steel or wooden one.

I think crafting copper wires will work best for this. Anyways such an idea is already posted under Redstone. You can look at it here: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360073594031-Copper-transfer-redstone-signals
This would defeat the purpose of having to have a Silk Touch pickaxe to break an Ender Chest.

So you would have an ender chest minecart in your base? I don't see this as defeating any purpose for the ender chest and I'm sure that by the time someone gets an ender chest, they will have a silk touch pick.

Pertaining to the horns,

Perhaps there could be different horns for different volumes or tones of sound, which could be used with skulk sensors. I've seen some people are interested in special features for those blocks, so this could be one way to handle it -- where the goat horn could be crafted with different materials, or come in different grades, to make certain tones to cause the sensors to act in slightly different ways, or even deafening them for a period of time.
Yes this would be great that way their is some actual reason you would go and look for horns in the moutains because if they did not have a use like this there would be little point in acquiring them
Or perhaps a goat horn potion could work similar to the potion of the turtle master and be a combination of two effects, perhaps jump and speed boost.

This sounds epic!

It won't work. Dynamic lighting is a performance issue within the base game, not to mention being especially problematic for low-end PC users. Also, there are mods for this concept, for any visible light source.

This is just a great idea.  I get that it could cause performance issues, but for those PCs that could handle it, it would be an absolutely incredible addition to the game.  Perhaps this could be a feature that could be turned on/off in the video settings so it could be turned off if causing performance issues.

Just imagine how cool it would be running through a dripstone cave with a lantern in one hand and a sword in the other!

If you are on java, you could just use shaders, if you are on windows 10 edition (sorry MPCE, Nintendo switch, PlayStation and Xbox) you can use ray tracing if you have an rtx capable GPU (If you don't, its overated) which I believe has dynamic lighting, which is what you are looking for.

about bats, i don't think it's a good idea cuz it gives warden more liveliness. or it can be explained that warden knows about bats and knows they're not who he's looking for but then it would be cool if he'll stop paying attention to bat only after it made some sound, something like warden recognized it
There should be some sort of limit to how much the warden could climb - 64 blocks?

Giving the Warden a bigger height jump would definitely scare people not expecting it. Also if the player is pillaring up, the Warden should jump up to reach the player once it reaches the pillar. Also, the Warden should have the ability to swim underwater, so that if the player tries to escape underwater with a Respiration helmet, the Warden can continue the chase. Though the Warden should wait 5 seconds when on water or until the player breaks a block (while submerged) to swim downwards.

I think that Minecraft would be more interesting if you were able to use goat horns to tame the warden because, wardens can be found in ancient cities so there would probably be some kind of people that used to play music.
End ore
I could use a better idea of how this works in the game.
The magnets could attract iron and/or copper. It could also attract other things with iron or copper inside it.

The idea of the skulk being a hivemind is also an interesting idea that could be explored on its own, for example:

 

Certain attacks on the blocks could delay the wardens attacks, or even enrage them!

Defeating the warden could cause the decay of the skulk in the area, or destroying the heart (core block) of the skulk could have this effect. 

Appeasing the skulk in some way, possibly by feeding a mouth or digestive epithelium like block, could calm down the warden or even make them temporarily an ally, though this may offset the risk reward of the deep dark and would have to be a rare block or balanced in some way.

 

These are just a few I'm spitballing right now, but there is definitely potential for some interesting mechanics here!
Then why not just make redstone go up walls? Why add a whole new material?

maybe you get speed boost and strength if you get hit bye lightning?
More people need to see this.
I honestly like this suggestion. It could really expand upon the oddities and Intrigue that the Deep dark already provides, also the name sounds really ridiculous, which really adds to that.

Nice idea! Maybe it could be harmless when touched, but begin drowning the player once fully submerged, giving it unique properties.

i think i would be really cool to see more complex and connected water systems.  maybe rushing rivers could someday be added that would push the player in the direction of the river, like moving water.
I wonder why they don't do it. Now would be the proper opportunity.

Agreed, especially now that the Copper Golem isn't getting added, copper is completely useless, both of those recipes could have just used Iron or gold. Honestly my suggestion would have been to remove copper outright.

Copper, like many other aesthetically-focused items/blocks in the past several updates, have largely added little to nothing important to the game. I find a much more enriching experience staying all the way back on 1.12 with a Forge-modded world I can customize with way more content, much of which is functional, but even fluff-filled aesthetic mods offer more than the official game does. Heck, even newer content has been back-implemented into mods, letting me selectively experience the new content that I may enjoy, whilst skipping out on all the rest... but only on the Java version.

I weep for the poor Bedrock players, especially on console, who have to deal with:
1) Forced updating so they can't enjoy the older versions
2) Inferior control schemas
3) Lack of modding to custom-tailor/enrich the game experience
4) Limitations on multiplayer world choices (ex: Java can self-host for free)
5) Microtransactions galore, though thankfully only for aesthetics, which happen to be more restricted than on Java...
Getting 2-5 raw copper from one ore is way to much for something that is pretty much worthless... Why cant we get more iron from the ore?

on java copper means legit nothing who needs a telescope when optifine and a million other mods had zoom to boot and then a lighting rod has no real purpose as of rn its just a useless building block that at best looks mid. i dont wanna go mining and think i might get iron and get closer and be disappointed at the fools gold of ores

Omg! Way too much copper! It seems around every corner is copper which is basically 100% useless which I wouldn‚Äôt mind if it didn‚Äôt feel like it is just taking up the space for coal and iron. My wife and I are playing through Minecraft and this is her first time and I feel bad because we have to resource guard coal and iron like mad men especially being so late in the game to and still we having to scrimp and save for coal and we are even still having to make charcoal! With how many hours of game play we are at I‚Äôd normally be going into the nether and and be working on full diamond equipment but this go around we have chests full of copper ore and barely can start to afford a full iron setup.

I think a simple solution would be to add more uses for copper for regular players. Don't get me wrong, it's a beautiful building block, but for non-builders such as myself it is somewhat useless. Honestly, Mojang just needs to dedicate an update to solidifying copper as a necessary ore/material in the game. It may not sound the most interesting or diverse update to the game, but without it I think copper won't be considered essential.

Personally, I think they should add copper tools and armor, it could replace iron and have 250 durability and also be used to mine iron, lapis, nether gold, and nether quartz ore; then iron tools/armor can be upgraded to have 800 or 900 durability to bridge the tool progression gap towards diamond, keeping the ability to then mine diamond, emerald, gold, and redstone ores, though of course stone would lose the ability to mine iron and lapis ore to maintain the progression (stone -> copper -> iron -> diamond). Mojang could utilize the oxidization of copper to make a very unique toolset, like they become more brittle but toughen up, allowing oxidized copper pickaxes to mine diamond and redstone ores at a slower speed or decreasing attack speed but increasing damage (but critical hits with an oxidized copper sword will use more durability). Another feature could be enchantability with a fresh copper tool is closer to gold, but oxidized copper is closer to iron. Idk, seems like a missed opportunity to not have copper tools/armor in the game.

Another missed opportunity, particularly with Tricky Trials, is not adding more copper-related-redstone blocks to the game. I don't know all what they could add in this regard, but I saw some concept art with a copper fan block blowing air; this would have fit right in with the trial chambers and would be a fascinating new redstone block/mechanic. The copper golem also sounded interesting, but I didn't vote for it because I didn't like the randomization of it; if there was a way to control them or control the order/timing of copper buttons they pressed I think they'd be a great addition to automated redstone. The randomization could be great for flickering lights, but I'd like some method of control to choose between random button mashing and a fine-tuned automatic machine. Copper rails would be great, but an improvement to minecart/rail transportation mechanics is a completely different tangent.
